docs.title: Presentation
docs.text:
Warning

This tool is under development, big improvements or changes may appear.

cav is a Command Line Interface for Orange CloudAvenue Platform. Is supported by the most used operating systems. Is a terminal app built to give a basic view to your Cloud Avenue IaaS. You can list, delete and create some basic infrastructure. Is based on the Terraform Provider Cloud Avenue

docs.title: When to use it
docs.text:
cav is able to give you a quik view of your Cloud Avenue Infrastructure. It can quickly create an object with a simple template defined in the application coding (in futur release with a parameter template). No needs to use terraform to see your IAAS state. It is recommended to use it when you want to perform a quick operation on your infrastructure. See demo below

Info

If you need more information about Cloud Avenue, please visit Cloud Avenue documentation.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
How to use the CLI

$> cav
cav is the Command Line Interface for CloudAvenue Platform

Usage:
  cav [command]

Available Commands:
  completion  Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
  create      Create resource to CloudAvenue.
  delete      Delete resource from CloudAvenue.
  get         Get resource to retrieve information from CloudAvenue.
  help        Help about any command
  update      Check for updates and update the application
  version     Print the version number of cav

Flags:
  -h, --help      help for cav
  -t, --time      time elapsed for command

Use "cav [command] --help" for more information about a command.

See All Commands reference

docs.title: Package
docs.text:
Debian/UbuntuRedhat/Centos/FedoraAlpine 
curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_checksums.txt \
&& curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_386.deb \
&& sha256sum --ignore-missing -c cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_checksums.txt \
&& sudo dpkg -i cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_386.deb

curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_checksums.txt \
&& curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_386.rpm \
&& sha256sum --ignore-missing -c cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_checksums.txt \
&& sudo rpm -i cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_386.rpm

curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_checksums.txt \
&& curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_386.apk \
&& sha256sum --ignore-missing -c cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_checksums.txt \
&& sudo apk add cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_386.apk

Note

For other Arch please replace word `386` by `amd64` or `arm64`

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
Invoke-WebRequest https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_checksums.txt -OutFile "cav-checksum.txt"
Invoke-WebRequest https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_windows_amd64.zip -OutFile "cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_windows_amd64.zip"
Expand-Archive -LiteralPath 'cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_windows_amd64.zip' -DestinationPath 'c:\cloudavenue\'
Get-FileHash 'c:\cloudavenue\cav.exe' -Algorithm SHA256 | Format-List

Note

Check the value of checksum in the cav-checksum.txt file. And add 'c:\cloudavenue\' in your PATH

docs.title: MacOS X
docs.text:
MacOS (ARM64)MacOS (AMD64)MacOS X(brew) 
curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_darwin_arm64.tar.gz \
&& tar xvf cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_darwin_arm64.tar.gz \
&& sudo chmod 755 ./cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_darwin_arm64/cav \
&& sudo mv ./cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_darwin_arm64/cav /usr/local/bin

curl -LO https://github.com/orange-cloudavenue/cloudavenue-cli/releases/download/v0.1.1/cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_darwin_amd64.tar.gz \

&& sudo mv ./cloudavenue-cli_v0.1.1_darwin_amd64/cav /usr/local/bin

docs.title: cav
docs.text: cav is the Command Line Interface for CloudAvenue Platform

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help   help for cav
  -t, --time   time elapsed for command

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• cav add - Add resource to CloudAvenue.
  • cav completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
  • cav del - Delete resource(s) from CloudAvenue.
  • cav get - Get resource to retrieve information from CloudAvenue.
  • cav update - Check for updates and update the application
  • cav version - Print the version number of cav

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
#Add a VDC (Virtual Data Center) to CloudAvenue
    cav add vdc --name myvdc

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• cav - cav is the Command Line Interface for CloudAvenue Platform
  • cav add edgegateway - Add an edgeGateway
  • cav add publicip - Add a public ip
  • cav add s3 - Add an S3 bucket
  • cav add vdc - Add an vdc (virtual data center) to CloudAvenue.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Add an edgeGateway in a VDC. If the T0 is not specified, the first one will be used. No need to specify a name, the edgeGateway name is auto-generated.

cav add edgegateway [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help         help for edgegateway
      --t0 string    t0 name
      --vdc string   vdc name

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help          help for publicip
      --name string   edgegateway name

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help          help for s3
      --name string   s3 bucket name

docs.title: cav add vdc
docs.text:
Add an vdc (virtual data center) to CloudAvenue.

cav add vdc [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help          help for vdc
      --name string   vdc name

docs.title: cav completion
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for cav for the specified shell. See each sub-command's help for details on how to use the generated script.

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• cav - cav is the Command Line Interface for CloudAvenue Platform
  • cav completion bash - Generate the autocompletion script for bash
  • cav completion fish - Generate the autocompletion script for fish
  • cav completion powershell - Generate the autocompletion script for powershell
  • cav completion zsh - Generate the autocompletion script for zsh

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the bash shell.

This script depends on the 'bash-completion' package. If it is not installed already, you can install it via your OS's package manager.

To load completions in your current shell session:

source <(cav completion bash)

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

docs.title: macOS:
docs.text:
cav completion bash > $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion.d/cav

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

cav completion bash

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for bash
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • cav completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the fish shell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

cav completion fish | source

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

cav completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/cav.fish

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

cav completion fish [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for fish
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • cav completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for powershell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

cav completion powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression

To load completions for every new session, add the output of the above command to your powershell profile.

cav completion powershell [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for powershell
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • cav completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the zsh shell.

If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment you will need to enable it. You can execute the following once:

echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions in your current shell session:

source <(cav completion zsh)

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

docs.title: macOS:
docs.text:
cav completion zsh > $(brew --prefix)/share/zsh/site-functions/_cav

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

cav completion zsh [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for zsh
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • cav completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• cav - cav is the Command Line Interface for CloudAvenue Platform
  • cav del edgegateway - Delete an edgeGateway (name or id).
  • cav del publicip - Delete public ip resource(s)
  • cav del s3 - Delete a s3 bucket
  • cav del vdc - Delete a vdc

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Delete an edgeGateway (name or id), multiple edgeGateway can be deleted at once.

cav del edgegateway [flags]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: del edgegateway <id or name> [<id or name>] [<id or name>] ...

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
#Delete a Public IP
    cav del ip 192.168.0.2

    #Delete several vdc named xxxx and yyyy
    cav del vdc xxxx yyyy

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:

  • cav delete edgegateway - Delete an edgeGateway (name or id)
  • cav delete publicip - Delete public ip resource(s)
  • cav delete s3 - Delete a s3 bucket
  • cav delete vdc - Delete a vdc

Delete an edgeGateway (name or id)

cav delete edgegateway [flags]

docs.title: cav get
docs.text: Get resource to retrieve information from CloudAvenue.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
#List all T0
    cav get t0

    #List all T0 in wide format
    cav get t0 -o wide

    #List all Public IP
    cav get publicip

    #List all VDC in yaml format
    cav get vdc -o yaml

    #List all S3 in json format
    cav get s3 -o json

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help            help for get
  -o, --output string   Output format. One of: (wide, json, yaml)

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• cav - cav is the Command Line Interface for CloudAvenue Platform
  • cav get bms - A brief list of your BMS resources
  • cav get edgegateway - A brief list of your edgegateway resources
  • cav get publicip - A brief list of your public ip resources
  • cav get s3 - A brief list of your s3 resources
  • cav get t0 - A brief list of your t0 resources
  • cav get vdc - A brief list of your vdc resources

docs.title: cav get bms
docs.text: A brief list of your BMS resources

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
A complete list information of your BMS resources in your CloudAvenue account. The default output format print the minimal necessary information like name, status or group. You can use the -o flag to specify the output format. "wide" will print some additional information. "json" or "yaml" will print the result in the specified format.

cav get bms [flags]

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text:
-o, --output string   Output format. One of: (wide, json, yaml)
  -t, --time            time elapsed for command

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • cav get - Get resource to retrieve information from CloudAvenue.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Two ways possible to configure your CLI.

docs.title: Configuration File
docs.text:
On the first try, a config file locate in your home directory, under the following path .cav/config.yaml will be generated.

> cav
Configuration file created in /root/.cav/config.yaml
Please fill it with your credentials and re-run the command.

You can set your credentials like this:

cloudavenue:
    username: "yourUserName"
    password: "YourStrongPassword"
    org: "cav01exxxxxxxxxx"
    url: ""
    debug: false

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
Credentials can be provided by using the CLOUDAVENUE_ORG, CLOUDAVENUE_USERNAME, and CLOUDAVENUE_PASSWORD environment variables, respectively. Other environnement variables related to List of Environment Variables can be configured.

For example:

export CLOUDAVENUE_ORG="my-org"
export CLOUDAVENUE_USERNAME="my-user"
export CLOUDAVENUE_PASSWORD="my-password"

Warning

If all variables are set, the CLI override the file configuration to use credentials setted in variables.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: The binary cav will be installed in /usr/local/bin/ directory.

docs.title: Manual installation
docs.text:
For advanced use cases, CloudAvenue-cli project offers manual installation methods. However, it is recommended to use the Automatic method of installation and fixing any issues there, instead of performing a full manual installation below.

See the guide on Advanced Installation for more details
